latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

title: A bill to direct the Federal Communications Commission to issue reports after activation of the Disaster Information Reporting System and to make improvements to network outage reporting, to categorize public safety telecommunicators as a protective service occupation under the Standard Occupational Classification system, and for other purposes.
ai_summary: A bill to direct the Federal Communications Commission to issue reports after activation of the Disaster Information Reporting System. A bill to categorize public safety telecommunicators as a protective service occupation under the Standard Occupational Classification system. The bill would also make improvements to network outage reporting and for other purposes. It was introduced by Rep. Steve Israel, D-Illinois. It passed the House of Representatives with a vote of 50-0. It will go to the Senate for a vote on a companion bill.
